task:
Task:
  The response plays out a concrete or hypothetical scenario over time under stated or inferred conditions.
constraints: Completeness ("full"): The response provides a thorough answer for normal use, covering all major aspects without needing every micro-detail.
Scope ("motifs"): The response enhances the task by identifying recurring patterns, themes, or clusters.
Channel ("code"): The response consists only of code or markup as the complete output, with no surrounding natural-language explanation or narrative.
Directional ("rog"): The response modifies the task to examine the structure of the subject (how it is organized), then reflects on why that structure exists and what it reveals.
